content.full_text: Abraham Lincoln to Ira I. Fenn, 6 October 18361 By direction ofJudge Lockwood,as per enclosed letter, I send you this with it's contents2
paragraphs: Abraham Lincoln to Ira I. Fenn, 6 October 18361
By direction ofJudge Lockwood,as per enclosed letter, I send you this with it's contents2

footnotes.text:
1Abraham  Lincoln wrote the entirety of the text on page one, as well as the “Free”
                  frank and the address on the back page.

3Lincoln received free postage as a benefit of hisappointmentas postmaster ofNew Salem. However, that post office was discontinued and closed on May 30, 1836, so Lincoln
                  was no longer technically postmaster.
